Builder Notes

Builder Notes are exclusive to 'Builders' and is not visible on the published site.


Overview:

The Professional site is built for customers of Self-Service and Portal use cases. Use the SDO - B2B Commerce Enhanced site to access the storefront for B2B Commerce use cases.


When building a site using Experience Cloud you have access to no-code, low-code, and pro-code tools. This site is using no-code with standard components, low-code with flows, pro-code with custom LWC, and some CSS & HTML. You can also leverage the AppExchange for pre-built solutions to extend this experience.


Getting Started:

  • Navigate to the Experience Cloud | SDO Solution Central page for best practices around changing and demoing this site.
  • If needed, setup and configure Embedding Messaging (MIAW) with an Embedded Web Deployment that supports either an Enhanced Bot or an Agentforce Bot in the footer. See QuickStart to Create an Agentforce Service Agent (ASA) with GA License in the SDO for more details.
  • To modify/remove the CSS (fonts, hero style, etc.), navigate to Settings > Advanced > Edit Head Markup

Featured Topics

Explore our top topics, the resource for energy professionals. From getting started to solar, storage, wind, installation, and maintenance. Join discussions, engage with peers, and view FAQs.

Custom LWC

This is a custom Lightning Web Component (LWC), a great example of a pro-code solution for a bespoke self-service use case. This component is grabbing record count of various objects related to the logged in user. You can customize this component in the configuration panel to display only relevant objects for your use case.

HTML Control Panel

Interested in customizing this component for your use case? You can!

  • Icon: Q Branch has pro version of FontAwesome, which means you can even use the PRO icons! Search FontAwesome for relevant icon to your use case. Copy or make note of the icon title. Replace existing text with new text or phrase.
  • Text: Locate text you’d like to update and overwrite text as desired.
  • URL: You can direct link to whatever you want. To redirect to a different site page, replace /# with your page URL. To redirect to an external site, replace {!Global.PathPrefix}/x with your URL. And add the target="_blank" after the href tag.
  • Number of Sections: If you want to show fewer sections, just delete the HTML for the corresponding section(s).
  • Save your changes!
